intro: Terpsichore longa, commonly known as the long-stemmed beauty, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three deeply lobed leaflets. Terpsichore longa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
